lab: Process Loop Component for Transmitter and Tank Applications
introduction: Welcome to the Process Loop Component Lab for the Transmitter and Tank Applications developed at CoEP. The main purpose of this laboratory is to make the students aware of the Transmitter and Tank Applications used in the industry. These components are the backbone of the industry. The working and configuration of these components require high-level skills and due to the cost of these instruments, no college can afford to have these for experimentation. Moreover, the calibration and maintenance required to continuously keep these instruments up and running are also tedious. This is an attempt to virtualize these instruments for thorough understanding.

experiments.name: Configure a Transmitter for the level control system
Configure a Transmitter for the pressure control system
Configure a Transmitter for the flow control system
Configure a Transmitter for the temperature control system
Estimate the time to fill the tank for the level control system
Estimate the time to empty the tank for the level control system(Gravity flow)

UG: B. Tech./ B.E in Instrumentation and Control Engineering, Chemical, Mechatronics, Mechanical Engineering branches
PG: MS/Ph. D. Beginners in Process Instrumentation, Mechatronics, Mechanical (Design) fluid power, and Chemical Engineering.

objective:
1. Configure the transmitter and tank component understudy
2. Analyse the effects of configurable parameters on the performance of the transmitter under test
3. Select the appropriate component as regards span, linearity, accuracy, and damping for the application.
4. Identify the faults in the component and rectify the same.

courseAlignment.description: The lab contents are chosen such that it covers the syllabi of the Process Loop Component for Transmitter and Tank Applications course of various universities to considerable extent.
universities: Institute having Instrumentation and control department

exp_name: Estimate the time to empty the tank for the level control system(Gravity flow)
